DOC.brief_summary: Anecdotal evidence suggest patient ' skin quality may improve result poly-L-lactic acid injection . While primary goal treatment often see describe call `` Sculptra glow '' . The aim study evaluate effect repeat subcutaneous injection poly-L-lactic acid ( Sculptra Aesthetic ) skin quality . Participating subject part study 15 month . There initial treatment period 12 week , follow 12-month follow-up period . There total 7 schedule visit . This study double-blind , randomize study . `` Double-blind '' mean neither subject study doctor know receive Sculptra Aesthetic placebo . `` Randomized '' mean group subject place decided chance , similar draw number hat flip coin . Subjects 1 2 chance receive active study drug . After completion study , subject assign control ( placebo ) group receive free injection Sculptra Aesthetic treatment group .
DOC.criteria: Subjects able give voluntary , write informed consent participate study consent obtain include HIPAA authorization Healthy females 30 60 year age Subjects Fitzpatrick photo skin type IIV Subjects shallow deep nasolabial fold contour deficiency facial wrinkle Subjects agree procedure affect facial wrinkle ( e.g . filler , botulinum toxin , radiofrequency , laser , IPL , ultrasound ) duration study Subjects agree procedure affect skin quality ( microdermabrasion , peel , acne treatment , etc . ) duration study Subjects understand study able follow study instruction willing attend require study visit Subjects agree photograph research reason identity may conceal photograph . Subjects pregnant , plan become pregnant breastfeeding . A urine pregnancy test do rule pregnancy Subjects childbearing potential use approved method birth control ( oral contraceptive , IUD , contraceptive implant , barrier method spermicide abstinence ) . Females nonchildbearing potential define postmenopausal ( absence menstrual bleed one year ) , hysterectomy bilateral oophorectomy . Subjects understand willing comply requirement study Subjects know allergy polyLlactic acid , carboxymethylcellulose , nonpyrogenic mannitol anesthetic Subjects take NSAIDs ( aspirin , ibuprofen , etc . ) within 7 day treatment Subjects take acetaminophen 24 hour treatment Subjects filler botulinum toxin treatment area past 12 month Subjects treatment polyLlactic acid face time Subjects kind facial dermabrasion , chemical peel , laser , IPL treatment include superficial treatment aesthetic reason past 6 month duration study Subjects agree avoid use tan bed intensive exposure sun 2 two week prior office visit . Subjects dermatologic condition include acne , rosacea , eczema , psoriasis , actinic keratosis , severe sun damage , infection scar within treatment area Subjects active inflammatory process ( skin eruption cyst , pimple , rash hive ) infection within treatment area Subjects know cancer include skin cancer ( basal cell carcinoma , squamous cell carcinoma melanoma ) Subjects systemic corticosteroid therapy past 6 month duration study Subjects know history poor wound heal Subjects know history keloid ( excessive scarring ) Subjects HIV positive Subjects exist medical condition Investigator considers may put subject risk compromise participation study Subjects participate another research study past 30 day Subjects currently involved injury litigation claim
